html: The possessive “your God” (vv 10, 13) expresses the covenant relationship Jehovah offers the Jacob/Israel category of his people so long as they rely on him to help them. Jehovah’s dual promise to uphold and sustain them by the right hand—his servant (ibid.)—reflects the exigency of the situation as they now face either deliverance or destruction. Just as a butterfly is first a “worm,” and just as “men” aren’t gods, so when they acknowledge their nothingness before God and trust in him to empower them, he can redeem them from evils he alone is capable of redeeming them from (Isaiah 43:1; 44:21-23; 48:20-21).
